māluta：m．[=māruta，Sk．marut，māruta] 風．　-irita [māluterita] 風に動かされたる．

māluta： māluta（pu）
မာလုတ（ပု）
[mara+uta．，ṭī．37．]
[မရ+ဥတ။ ဓာန်၊ဋီ။၃၇။]

Māluta，[the proper Pali form for māruta，the a-stem form of maru2=Vedic marut or māruta] wind，air，breeze S．IV，218； Th．I，2； II，372； J．I，167； IV，222； V，328； VI，189； Miln．319； Vism．172 （=vāyu）； VvA．174，178．

--īrita （contracted to māluterita） moved by the wind，fanned by the breeze Th．1，754； II，372； Vv 4412=816； Pv．II，123．See similar expressions under īrita．（Page 531）

Māluta：Once，two friends，a lion and a tiger，lived in a cave．They had a dispute as to which was the cold part of the month，the dark half or the light，and they referred the matter to a hermit （the Bodhisatta），who said that the cold was caused by wind and not by light or darkness．

The story was told to two forest dwelling monks of Kosala，Kāla and Junha，who consulted the Buddha in a similar dispute．The lion and the tiger are identified with the monks．J．i．164ff．

māluta：မာလုတ（ပု）
[မရ+ဥတ။ ဓာန်၊ဋီ။၃၇။]
（၁） လေ။ （၂） မာလုတမည်သူ （စကြာမင်း）။
